title: Do I deserve a frigging 14 day ban for this?
body:

replies.body: Yes you deserve the ban, your being toxic because your team doesn't do what you want.

And I suppose the fact that what I'm asking for is teamwork holds absolutely no water whatsoever?

By this logic, you can behave however you like to your teammates....refuse to communicate, never group, die, feed and throw the game...but as long as you don't say any meany weany words and hurt their precious widdle feelings you'll be fine. 

I asked him nicely. I asked him nicely again. And he STILL refuses to listen. Ten million pings and constant requests to group up (and not just from me mind you) and I'M the one who deserves a ban?

Yeah no.
Yep, toxic mate, deserved your ban

Righto. next time I go into a game. I'm not listening to anyone and just gonna fart around and do my own thing despite the fact that it will ruin other peoples fun and cost them the win. 

But as long as nobodies delicate widdle feelings get hurt hey?

Dude 2 wrongs don't make a right.

Lucian may be in the wrong by refusing to communicate etc.

However you being a toxic shit did nothing to help, and deserves a ban.

Bans don't come out of no where, and i would bet this isn't the first game you have been like this, so enjoy the ban and learn to be less toxic or face a perma ban down the line.

Stop being toxic. Full stop.

Simply because you got a ban doesn't mean Lucian was right. That's the black and white thinking that leads to generally nasty things. If you both got bans, I wouldn't be surprised.

Either way, you deserved it fully, forget about Lucian, this is about you and your performance only.

I feel your pain.

then again, I had a ragey twat in two games last night who was literally worse than useless who blamed his own team for EVERYTHING and it made play incredibly painful.

So I guess it is contextual. If you're shit and just a raging tool, then you deserve the ban. If you're a half decent player 1) you should probably know better, 3) what happened to 2, and 2) ah there it is.

> [{quoted}](name=Essembie,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=U1FsBTEF,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-10-26T08:58:49.423+0000)
>
> If you're a half decent player 1) you should probably know better, 3) what happened to 2, and 2) ah there it is.

This was too good xD

Simply put this way, some players do NOT like being told what to do and there is nothing you or anyone can do about it.

I remember a very distinct game I had recently in where out Yas never grouped, and I mean never. The one time he did group with us was for a few seconds, just as he left the enemy ganked us, killed us and did you know where he was?

We were in the inhibitor tower bot lane just outside their base, he was in the same place in mid, while we were being ganked, while I was constantly pinging him and after I died typing for him to help, he ignored us like he did for the entire game and lo and behold, blamed us for the lose.

Every time I looked at the map he was in a lane with no enemies, in the jungle, running away or doing something to not help us, but no, according to him it was our fault for losing.

Like you, I started nicely asking for him to group, but some 20 minutes later I was not so nice. After this game being in a long line of very similar games I like many others finally came to the conclusion, fuck it, no matter what you do there will always be that one ass monger who cares more about his own existence than anything else on earth and will inevitably end up in your game to just ruin it.

All you can do is try your best, report them and move on. The quicker you can discern that type of player means the faster you will notice if they are in your game, try your best to win, and simply brace yourself for the lose, it hurts less that way.

You know what the most tragic part is?

Reporting the selfish afk ass nugget for refusal to communicate/negative attitude and so on means absolutely nothing to the banning system. From what I've seen, literally the only thing that matters is triggering curse word sensors and report volume. You can behave HOWEVER you like so long as you don't actually swear.

This is the kind of thing Dunkey griped about in his "last" League vid. 

"Now, there is so much wrong with this. First, why am I being banned for talking shit in a videogame? I can understand being banned for cheating, or going afk a bunch of times, or picking Orianna ad carry or feeding on purpose, but talking shit to some guy that is a total dumbass? What is this? Fucking pussy ass baby pre-school time?" I might as well just play the bots if you want people to act like robots Riot."

And he's right. Hell just look at the comments on that video...people get banned for swearing in a full pre-made team, but toxic douchebags who go out of their way to screw with people get virtually zero punishment whatsoever. Riot is hilariously amateur and naive when it comes to this sort of thing. They don't look at the support tickets you send them properly (I had my account permabanned because I asked for help regarding other players who were THREATENING ME WITH MY PERSONAL DETAILS, and it took them three days and me asking them what they hell they've done to realize they fucked up), they don't take individual games into account, they dont own up to any mistakes they've made, they cant be bothered to get off their ass and fix peoples unfair bans when their servers go down...they just go by this blanket program that indiscriminately punishes people for swearing. And as we all know, swearing in a videogame makes you Super-Hitler.

They are trying their best to "PG-ify" their game using an indiscriminate and unfair banning system and it just aint gonna happen. 

Think of League of Legends as a nice dinner in a fancy house. Everything is well presented, was worked hard on can be enjoyed by anyone who sits at the table. Unfortunately, people tend to be messy eaters. They drool, drop things on the floor, spill their drink and fart noisily. You are NOT going to change this happening by kicking everyone who does it (intentionally or otherwise) out of the house...you are just going to look like an elitist asshole. 

If League is a fancy dinner in a nice house, what it lacks is a refuse basket...where guests can appropriately offhand all their feral uneaten scraps and partially chewed napkins into something that isn't part of the proper table. Because right now, all that shit is getting spread out in-front of everyone and getting on the fine china..making the host uncomfortable and embarrassing him infront of his snooty neighbor. 

Put simply, League needs a dumping ground for the inherent anger and frustration it tends to cause. A forum, a website, a Facebook page.....SOMETHING. Just somewhere people can collectively offload their League related rage in a completely safe and consequence free zone.
Have you ever thought that maybe you were just being a c*nt and that ban was generous on Riot's part? Stop ruining the game.
To be fair to the op that's pretty standard conversation in bronze.

As much as I can see your point in trying to talk to Lucian, I must admit that you do seem toxic as all hell. Tone down the swearing, the insults, and the general rage-child behaviour, and then you might have "gotten away with it"
Obnoxious and profane. I don't really see what argument could be brought against your temp ban other than saying it was slightly too lenient or too strict.

Check out my thread, "i got slapped with a two week ban".
